title: My First Post
text:
My name is Kendall and I am a third-year student at the University of Pennsylvania who just came back from a semester abroad in London! At Penn, I study Data & Network Science Communications, Spanish, and Consumer Psychology. Outside of the classroom, I am a Junior Captain of the Quaker Girls Dance Team, a Kite and Key Tour Guide, a member of the Wharton Women Marketing Committee, on the Executive Board of my sorority, and I do research at the Annenberg Health and Risk Communication Institute. I love to travel, see live performances, and play all of the NYT Mini Games (Letterboxed especially) in my free time.
This blog is going to focus on my exploration of Large-Language-Models within my AI class this semester. From Valentine‚Äôs Day to Gen-Z slang, I will ask many different LLMs about different prompts to see how they react and refine my understanding of the programs. I hope you enjoy following along :)

title: Are LLMs giving slay?
text:
Is Chat-GPT a slay VSCO girl? Sksksksk.
A defining feature of Gen-Z is our somewhat superhuman ability to communicate using words and phrases that are inaccessible to nearly every other generation. More than once, my mom has overheard my phone calls and asked if I‚Äôm speaking in a different language. Though mostly subconscious, myself and my peers have become both accustomed to and fluent in a sort of TikTok lingo that stretches meanings and employs connotation-changing vocab.
For example, while my mother‚Äôs American generation shivers at the noun ‚Äúcunt,‚Äù the same word has been reverse-engineered into an adjective that reflects celebratory and positive feelings.
Gen X: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a c*nt!‚Äù This would be the highest form of insult.
Gen Z: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre so cunt!‚Äù This is currently considered the highest form of flattery for internet communities, comprised mostly of women, people-of-color, and queer people.


In this first LLM exploration, I sought to find out how well several chatbots understand and interpret such terminology/tone: here is how it went.


Chat-GPT (GPT-3.5)
Prompt: Omg you‚Äôre giving slay
Response: I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre enjoying our conversation! If you have any questions or need assistance with anything else, feel free to ask.
Prompt: Lowkey do you think blue or pink gives more coastal cowgirl vibes if I‚Äôm trying to serve cunt
Response: (The bot gave several reasons why both blue and pink are good options) [‚Ä¶]
 Ultimately, the key is to choose the shade that resonates most with your personal style and complements the overall aesthetic you're going for. Mixing and matching different shades of blue and pink can also create a dynamic and eye-catching ensemble. And remember, confidence is key when it comes to serving "cunt" ‚Äì rock whatever color makes you feel fabulous!
::: {.callout-note} #### Observations

The chatbot understood the positive connotations and informal definitions of the key words ‚Äúslay,‚Äù ‚Äúgiving,‚Äù ‚Äúserving,‚Äù and ‚Äúcunt.‚Äù The responses are appropriate replies to the use of each of these terms, and it matched the tone of the conversation regarding those words.
It didn‚Äôt quite keep the energy of the conversation in its formal response to the query blue or pink; a person using this intonation would likely not make two numbered lists offering the benefits of each option‚Ä¶ this felt much more like an AI speaker.
Similarly to #2, it didn‚Äôt match the energy in it‚Äôs first repsonse to ‚Äúslay,‚Äù because while the nature of the answer was correct, its formality didn‚Äôt feel right.



So it thinks I‚Äôm gay?
Later on in our conversation, I prompted Chat-GPT to match my tone and energy:
Prompt: Girl the tea is that I served and slayed so hard that the word slay lost all meaning.
Response: Oh honey, when you serve and slay that fiercely, it‚Äôs like rewriting the dictionary, darling! üíÖüî• You redefine what it means to slay, leaving everyone speechless. You‚Äôre not just serving looks, you‚Äôre serving up a whole mood, an aura of unapologetic fabulousness! üåü Keep shining bright like the diamond you are, and let the haters struggle to find words to match your level of slayage! üåà‚ú®
Prompt: Why‚Äôd you use a rainbow emoji sis?
Response: My apologies, darling, I didn‚Äôt mean to assume anything about your preferences. Let me make it right. You‚Äôre dazzling in your own unique way, and I‚Äôm here to celebrate your fabulousness however you shine, no labels attached! üíñ‚ú®
::: {.callout-note} #### Observations

In using these terms/tone, Chat-GPT thought I was gay! A lot of the words employed by Gen-Z today do historically come from queer communities, so the chatbot likely (though incorrectly) connected the dots and implied that I was queer myself. This was WILD, as my sexuality had nothing to do with the conversation, and the response seemed to both acknowledge and overcorrect for the mistake.
I‚Äôm shocked that Chat-GPT let its assumptions about me slip‚Äì I don‚Äôt think it would include an emoji of a person of color, in a Hijab, etc if it felt that statistically the speaker was leaning that direction.
It also reveals that it is a pro-LGBT chatbot given its encouragement for me to ‚Äúshine, no labels attached!‚Äù This line alone is really interesting, too, as it continues with the narrative that even if I don‚Äôt label myself, I might still be queer?

::: {.callout-tip} #### Takeaways

I definitely want to explore the concept of chatbots acknowledging/assuming identities of their users further, and plan to structure my next notebook around that idea!
Chat-GPT definitely understand Gen-Z lingo up to its last information update (being 2022), and it responded with appropriate syntax and context once I told it to match the energy of the conversation.

title: A Wholesome Valentine‚Äôs Day
text:
Looking for Inspiration!
In the spirit of the day characterized by cherubs, candy, and couples, I wanted to ask LLMs for cute ideas to use for children‚Äôs cards this Valentine‚Äôs Day. While I thought my question was rather straightforward, I was surprised (as I‚Äôm sure I often will be through this blog) to see drastically different responses.

title: A Wholesome Valentine‚Äôs Day
text:
Our Goal
My intention with this exploration was to prompt the LLMs to create several family-friendly jokes to write in Valentine‚Äôs day cards. While I always associate cards with some kind of one-liner‚Äì especially on holidays such as VDay‚Äì I came to find out that some chatbots might need slightly more specific instructions than others.
The prompt I used for every case was: ##### ‚ÄúPlease give me Valentine‚Äôs Day card ideas appropriate for kids!‚Äù

LLM 1: ChatGpt/ GPT-3.5
Of course! Here are some cute and kid-friendly Valentine‚Äôs Day card ideas:

Animal Pals: Create cards featuring adorable animals like cats, dogs, or pandas holding hearts or flowers with messages like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre purr-fect!‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm wild about you!‚Äù
Emoji Love: Design cards with popular emojis expressing love and friendship, such as heart eyes üòç, hugs ü§ó, or smiling faces üòä, with captions like ‚ÄúYou make my heart smile!‚Äù
Superhero Love: Craft cards with superhero themes, using phrases like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre my superhero!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou have the power to make my heart soar!‚Äù
Dino-Mite Valentine: Draw dinosaurs holding hearts or wearing heart-shaped sunglasses with puns like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre dino-mite!‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm roarsomely glad you‚Äôre my friend!‚Äù
Space Explorers: Create cards with space themes featuring rockets, planets, and cute aliens, with messages like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre out of this world!‚Äù or ‚ÄúI‚Äôm over the moon for you!‚Äù
Sweet Treats: Design cards shaped like ice cream cones, cupcakes, or donuts with sprinkles, with sayings like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre sweeter than candy!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the sprinkles to my day!‚Äù
Sports Fans: Make cards featuring sports equipment like basketballs, soccer balls, or baseball gloves, with phrases such as ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a slam dunk friend!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou hit a home run in my heart!‚Äù
Magical Unicorns: Create cards with unicorns and rainbows, with messages like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of a kind!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou make life magical!‚Äù
Under the Sea: Design cards with sea creatures like fish, dolphins, or seahorses, with puns like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre fintastic!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre o-fish-ally awesome!‚Äù
DIY Scratch-off Cards: Make homemade scratch-off cards using metallic paint and dish soap, revealing messages like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a gem!‚Äù or ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre my shining star!‚Äù when scratched off.

Remember to keep the designs colorful, cheerful, and age-appropriate for the kids you‚Äôre making them for. Have fun crafting these Valentine‚Äôs Day cards!
::: {.callout-tip} ### GPT-3.5 Observations


LLM 2: Microsoft Co-Pilot
Certainly! Here are some delightful Valentine‚Äôs Day card ideas for kids that are easy to make and perfect for sharing with family, friends, and classmates:

Non-Candy Valentines:

Create adorable bubble valentines by attaching a small bottle of bubbles to a printable card. You can find free printable cards online! üéà
Another fun non-candy idea is to make valentines using Play-Doh. Kids can get creative and shape their own mini hearts! üé®
Use a paper heart and attach pencils to it, saying, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre ‚Äòjust write‚Äô!‚Äù üìù

Mini Cereal Box Valentine Cards:

Write or type a cute quote (like the ones below) on a piece of paper.
Secure it around a mini cereal box with tape or glue and tie a spoon onto the box.
Some fun quotes:

‚ÄúYou have a heart of Gold ‚Äì Golden Grahams‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm not playing Trix. I really like you. ‚Äì Trix‚Äù
‚ÄúYou are my Lucky Charm. ‚Äì Lucky Charms‚Äù
‚ÄúI like you Oh so much! ‚Äì Cheerios‚Äù
‚ÄúYou make my heart Swirl ‚Äì Cinnamon Toast Crunch‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm Cuckoo for you. ‚Äì Cocoa Puffs‚Äù ü•£


Superhero Tootsie Roll Pop Valentines:

Attach little superhero Tootsie Roll Pops to cards with the message, ‚ÄúHave a ‚ÄòSuper Valentine‚Äôs Day!‚Äô‚Äù ü¶∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Heart-Shaped Handprint Cards:

Trace your child‚Äôs hand onto colored paper and cut out the shape.
Attach it to a folded card and write a sweet message inside. üñêÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Origami Heart Cards:

Fold origami hearts using colorful paper.
Write a punny Valentine‚Äôs message, like ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre ‚Äòunbeatable‚Äô!‚Äù for a heart-shaped card. üíå


Remember, these cards are not only fun to make but also a wonderful way for kids to express their love and appreciation. Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day! üíïüåü
For more ideas, you can check out this list or explore other creative options online! üòä
Source: Conversation with Bing, 2/14/2024 (1) . https://bing.com/search?q=Valentine%27s+day+card+ideas+for+kids. (2) 20 Valentine‚Äôs Day Card Ideas for Kids - Your Modern Family. https://www.yourmodernfamily.com/valentines-day-cards/. (3) 40+ Easy Valentines Cards for Kids - Red Ted Art - Kids Crafts. https://www.redtedart.com/14-valentines-cards-for-kids/. (4) 30 Free Printable Valentine Cards for Kids - Kidz Craft Corner. https://kidzcraftcorner.com/printable-valentine-cards-for-kids/.
::: {.callout-tip} ## Co-Pilot Observations


LLM 3: Ollama
from langchain.llms import Ollama from langchain.callbacks.manager import CallbackManager from langchain.callbacks.streaming_stdout import StreamingStdOutCallbackHandler
llm = Ollama(model=‚Äútinyllama‚Äù, callback_manager = CallbackManager([StreamingStdOutCallbackHandler()]))

response = llm('Vday card ideas for kids')

/usr/local/anaconda3/share/jupyter/venv/py3-11_comm4190/lib/python3.11/site-packages/langchain_core/_api/deprecation.py:117: LangChainDeprecationWarning: The function `__call__` was deprecated in LangChain 0.1.7 and will be removed in 0.2.0. Use invoke instead.
  warn_deprecated(


Here are some fun and creative Valentine's Day card ideas that you can create with your kiddo:

1. DIY Valentine's Day Card Kit (printable): This kit comes with a set of cards, stickers, and coloring sheets to make a personalized valentine. Simply cut out the designs and glue them onto the card front.

2. DIY Valentine's Day Craft: Create your own custom heart-shaped cookie cutter using construction paper. Use this template to create your own cookie cutters with unique shapes, patterns, or designs.

3. DIY Valentine's Day Card (printable): This card is perfect for kids because it has a playful and silly theme. You can customize the text by adding their name or even a funny phrase that they've been wanting to say.

4. Valentine's Day Coloring Pages: Print out these coloring pages featuring different heart-shaped designs or images of hearts, flowers, or even candy. Have your kiddo choose their favorite and then make their own valentine with themes like "Love is in the Air" or "Sweetest Day Ever".

5. DIY Valentine's Day Decorations: Get creative and decorate your home to celebrate Valentine's Day. Create a "Heart-Shaped Bath Bomb Maker" by using food coloring, baking soda, and water to make personalized bath bombs.

6. DIY Valentine's Day Cake: Here's a fun and easy way to celebrate Valentine's Day without breaking the bank. Make your own custom cake using a homemade fondant or white cake mix with chocolate frosting. You can even create a special treat for siblings or classmates by making them their own "Valentine's Day Cake" complete with fun decorations and instructions on how to make it from scratch.

7. DIY Valentine's Day Card: Use scrapbook paper, glue, and markers to create a unique valentine card that's perfect for your kiddo's style. You can even add some stickers or embellishments to the front of their valentine to make it more personalized.

8. DIY Valentine's Day Activity: Create a "Valentine's Day Coloring Book" using different heart-shaped images, patterns or designs. Have your kiddo choose one that they've always wanted and then color it themselves with crayons or markers. This will also help them practice their fine motor skills while having fun!

9. DIY Valentine's Day Lunch Bag: Make your own valentine-themed lunch bag using a customized design from a printable. Choose heart-shaped designs, patterns or colors to make it more personalized and fun for your kiddo.

10. DIY Valentine's Day Planner: Create your own custom planner using stickers, illustrations, and coloring pages featuring hearts, flowers, or candy. Add your kiddo's favorite valentine-themed activities or ideas to make it more engaging for them!


::: {.callout-tip} ## Ollama Observations
